channel.title: Milton Reynolds on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Milton Reynolds on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: Pens for Pennies
item.description: Today in Tedium: They’re seemingly everywhere, except when you actually need one. They always work, except when you’re using them. They haven’t been completely steamrolled by the digital revolution, because their disposability is a virtue. You can always buy another one for just a few cents in your nearest 7-Eleven or supermarket checkout lane. Or, if you’re really smart, you’ll hoard them in your bag or pocket—each one with a different logo—without even realizing it.
